metadata.title: wahl.chat - Understand Politics Interactively
metadata.description: Understand the goals and positions of parties for the 2025 German federal election. Chat with party programs at wahl.chat, ask questions about your topics and have party positions critically assessed.
metadata.twitter-title: wahl.chat | Party Programs for the 2025 German Federal Election
keywords: Entertainment Channel for the 2025 Federal Election

donation.title: Donate
donation.description: Keep wahl.chat alive with your donation!
donation.support-description: Help us cover ongoing AI costs!
donation.form-description: We currently finance <link>wahl.chat</link> entirely out of our own pockets. Your donation helps us continue this project and cover the costs for servers and AI.
donation.success-description: Thank you for your support! We will use your donation to enable neutral and independent information.
donation.failed-title: Your donation was unfortunately not successful.

about-us.team-image: in the picture from left to right
about-us.team-description: The wahl.chat team comes from Munich and came together in Cambridge, UK for joint AI research. With wahl.chat, we want to contribute to democracy by making politics more accessible. With regard to the 2025 federal election, we enable a source-based exchange about the positions of the parties, based among other things on their election programs.
about-us.thanks-supporters: We also thank them for their support:
about-us.join-team-start: If you want to help us, you are welcome to become part of the
about-us.support-description: Help us cover ongoing AI costs!
about-us.thesis-invitation: It is also possible to write your bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs thesis with us. The best way to do this is to contact us directly with a topic proposal:

common.iframe-description: To use wahl.chat in an iFrame, please contact us via the email address <email>info@wahl.chat</email>.

how-to.dialog-description: Tips and tricks on how to make the best use of wahl.chat.
how-to.intro: <underline>wahl.chat</underline> is an interactive AI tool that helps you learn about the positions and plans of the parties. You can ask the AI assistant questions about various political topics, and it provides neutral answers based on the <bold>party manifestos and other publications</bold>.
how-to.process-step-2: <underline>wahl.chat</underline> searches relevant documents such as manifestos to find the appropriate information.
how-to.process-step-3: The relevant information is then used to generate an understandable and neutral answer.
how-to.process-step-4: You can now have the party's position classified by clicking the button under the answer. Or have the answer analyzed based on the party's voting behavior.
how-to.questions-content-intro: In principle, you can ask all questions you have about the parties' manifestos or their positions. Furthermore, you can also ask questions about general topics such as the procedure of a federal election.
questions-party-specific: What is the SPD's position on climate protection?
How does the AfD stand on the debt brake?
How does the CDU/CSU want to reduce bureaucracy?
How do the Greens want to advance digitization?
How do the FDP and the Left want to implement the working time reform?
How do Volt and the FDP want to improve European cooperation?
questions-compare: How do the parties differ in the fight against climate change?
How do the positions of the CDU/CSU and the SPD differ on the topic of the debt brake?
Compare the positions of the FDP and AfD on the topic of migration.
questions-general: How can I apply for postal voting?
how-to.number-parties-trigger: How many parties can I chat with?
how-to.number-parties-content: You can start the chat with up to <bold>{max}</bold> parties at the same time, but you have the option to address even more parties during chatting. Furthermore, you can easily add or remove more parties through the plus button above the text field.
how-to.position-tooltip: Classify the position as Pro or Contra
how-to.position-content: When you click this button under one of the messages, the position of the message is classified. The following criteria are taken into account: Feasibility, Short-term and Long-term effects. Here we use current information and sources from the internet, which are provided to us by Perplexity.ai.
how-to.voting-behavior-content: When you click this button under one of the messages, the party's voting behavior in the past is analyzed. In addition, you can see detailed information on the party's votes by clicking on <italic>"Show votes"</italic>.
how-to.data-content-intro: To provide well-founded and neutral answers, <underline>wahl.chat</underline> uses a variety of data sources:

data-sources.title: Manifestos and other relevant documents:
data-sources.description: In addition to the election programs, manifestos and other documents from the parties are also used to obtain a comprehensive picture of the party positions.

data-sources.title: Position papers:
data-sources.description: In addition to the manifestos, election programs, position papers and other documents from the parties are also used to obtain a comprehensive picture of the party positions.

data-sources.title: Internet sources for classifying positions:
data-sources.description: For the differentiated classification of positions, <underline>wahl.chat</underline> uses the service Perplexity.ai, which uses high-quality internet sources such as news sites.

how-to.data-sources-link: We have listed all sources that <underline>wahl.chat</underline> uses <link>here</link>.
how-to.guidelines-trigger: What guidelines does wahl.chat follow in its answers?
how-to.guidelines-content-intro: The following guidelines apply to the answers in the chats:

guidelines-list.title: Source-based:
guidelines-list.description: The answers should be based on the relevant statements from the provided program excerpts.

guidelines-list.title: Neutrality:
guidelines-list.description: Party positions should be reproduced neutrally and without judgment.

guidelines-list.title: Transparency:
guidelines-list.description: For each statement, the relevant sources should be linked directly to enable detailed examination and verification of the content.

how-to.party-selection-trigger: According to what criteria are the parties selected?
how-to.party-selection-content: The original selection of the parties took place before the 2025 federal election and was based on the publication of their election programs. We now want to gradually add the missing parties, and we are very happy about your help. If you miss a party, please send us an email with their manifesto as a PDF attachment to <email>info@wahl.chat</email>, and we will add it as soon as possible.

swiper.disclaimer-intro: You wanted something like a Wahl-O-Mat ‚Äì here is a first attempt to implement your feedback.
swiper.disclaimer-warning: We would like to emphasize that this is only a first draft and does not represent an official voting recommendation.
swiper.disclaimer-feedback: Your feedback helps us develop a final version for the next election that solves existing problems.
swiper.disclaimer-thanks: Thank you for your understanding üôè - we look forward to your feedback! ü§ó
swiper.error-calculate-results: Error calculating your results. Please reload the page.
swiper.results-disclaimer: This result is only for initial orientation. Question it critically and look at the election programs yourself - our comparison chat can help:
swiper.share-result-description: Anyone with this link can view this result.
swiper.survey-description: We would be very happy if you share your feedback on our Election Swiper.
swiper.survey-login-additional: If you also want to be notified by us after the election when your opinions are implemented, you can sign in here.
swiper.party-result-consensus-description: {partyName} agrees with you on {consensus} out of {total} questions.
swiper.party-result-click-hint: Click on a question for more information.
swiper.skip-disclaimer-title: Do you want to learn more about the thesis?
swiper.skip-disclaimer-description: Use our {boldChat} to learn more about the thesis and make a {boldDecision}.
swiper.chat-placeholder: Start a conversation about this thesis to learn more about it.

ai-disclaimer.title: AI Notice
ai-disclaimer.introduction: The responses on wahl.chat are generated by <ai>artificial intelligence</ai>. They are based on information extracted from <public>publicly available party</public> and <programs>election programs</programs>. While wahl.chat strives to provide accurate information about party positions and values, the following applies:
ai-disclaimer.point1: The <processing>processing and generation</processing> of all content is <auto>automated.</auto>
ai-disclaimer.point2: The responses are <not>not to be understood as official party statements</not>.
ai-disclaimer.point3: <complex>Complex political positions</complex> may not be captured in all nuances.
ai-disclaimer.conclusion: This AI chat serves as an <tool>educational tool</tool> to learn about various political positions. For <binding>binding information</binding>, please use the <official>official party sources</official>.

budget-spent.title: Budget Depleted
budget-spent.description: Since we finance ourselves exclusively through donations, it can happen that our budget is depleted.
budget-spent.support-message: If you would like to support us, you are welcome to donate.

topics.title: Questions on Popular Topics
topics.description: Here you will find questions on the popular topics of the parties. Click on a question to see details.

sources.title: Sources that wahl.chat uses
sources.description: Our AI uses these sources for general answers. For classifying positions, we use Perplexity.ai, which relies on current information from the Internet.

sidebar.mobile-description: Start a new chat or select a previous conversation.
